name: Conrad Maldives Rangali Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Maldives in August. We arrived Male Airport pretty late at night which we could not get on the seaplane to the hotel. We reserved a hotel in town and did not realize that Conrad will start taking care of you as soon as you arrive the airport therefore we have reserved transfer to the hotel ourselves. Next day we met the staff at the airport and we were taken to the waiting lounge for the seaplane. We got free back massage while we are waiting for the seaplane they will take care of check in at that time.
reviews.title: In a paradise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After 30 minutes Seaplane ride, you are greeted with Island Host who will take care of you for the whole stay. There are two islands connected with a bridge. We checked in to Deluxe Beach Bungalow. We really loved it. The bathroom consisted of outdoor shower and outdoor tub. There is also a little private pool in the front yard. The room is well decorated. We upgraded the room to overwater spa bungalow for the experience and it was absolutely wonderful.
reviews.title: The perfect honeymoon...

reviews.text: In terms of food, we did try Ithaa and I would recommended 6.30 p.m. dinner so you could enjoy both day and night. 3 hours dinner was quite an experience. We also tried Sunset Grill and Vilu. Breakfast is also full of options. I believe they are manager reception every Tuesday when you can enjoy free drinks and a little party.
reviews.title: A truly stunning resort. We stayed here...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did full day scuba diving and the staff are very high standard divemasters. We did not get to do other trips due to the weather. The hotel also offer all non-motor sports free of charge. The house reef is very nice and we spotted a shark and lots of colorful fish and corals. Please try to go to the bridge at night where you can see manta rays in action.
reviews.title: Paradise
Perfection at every turn.
reviews.text: At the end of the trip we did spent quite some time at quiet zone. It is very relaxing and we did recharge ourselves ready to come back to work.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned after celebrating our 10th anniversary at Conrad Maldives Rangali Island - it was our first visit to Maldives and the best holiday we've ever had.
reviews.title: Paradise on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dining
reviews.title: heaven
Our best time we ever had!!
reviews.text: With such an array of restaurants you never get bored with the food. We didn't have a single bad, mediocre or good meal - each one was excellent...and hard to believe that we were in the middle of an ocean sampling the finest and freshest food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Wine Cellar dinner was the standout meal - and if you have to do just one fine dining meal i would recommend this. The Sommelier was great - very engaging and shared a lot of interesting facts - the food was brilliant and the other dinner guests were great company and made the evening a lot of fun. I didn't find the cellar cold and did not use the pashmina i carried - i also noticed they had white pashminas draped on each chair for guests.
reviews.title: Amazing Vacation for Complete Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mandhoo - was the second best meal we had - the mains are a tad small so we ordered 2 each plus shared a dessert. Each dish was exquisite. We also came here for the daily tea tasting (variety of teas/cookies/cakes/sandwiches) which was a nice way to end our afternoon snorkelling sessions.
reviews.title: Slice of Heaven on Earth

reviews.text: This property exceeded ALL our expectations! My husband, myself and our two college-age kids went on this long-anticipated vacation and visited this property for 6 nights before Christmas and we all had an absolutely wonderful time.
reviews.title: True Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property - Spotless, serene and amazingly beautiful! The infinity pool on the smaller island is our favorite place to hang out. Every direction you look is heaven on earth! Although the resort had at least 80% occupancy rate while we were there, we never felt it was crowded. In fact, there were times when we felt we were the only ones there!
reviews.title: The Best Holiday Ever!!!!

reviews.text: The water villas - Well-kept and clean. May be a bit dated and not as private with windows looking into the next villa... however, when I can walk out of the villa's private deck and down the stairs into the tranquil reef and be a good 200 feet out, gazing at colorful fish and abundant coral or watch the sun set, I have no complaints!
reviews.title: Outstanding location, everything else average and overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff - Always smiling and always helpful. We missed our connecting flight in Dubai and had to call in last minute to revise our seaplane schedule. The staff worked efficiently to help us get re-booked on another flight and everything went smoothly. And, as a result of the later arrival, we missed our original reservation for dinner at Wine Cellar. The next wine pairing dinner was fully booked, but our Island Host (Jennifer), worked miracle and we were able to get in. She is wonderful and always so helpful. Also, the breakfast staff at Vilu are exceptional! They were so nice, even when my son orders a second helping of steak and eggs just before closing. The only staff we consider not too friendly is the afternoon tea attendant at Mandhoo. But heck, that is just 1 out of 500...
reviews.title: One word is enough: Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants - Vilu for breakfast every morning. We loved the food selection and the ability to order a-la-carte. Everything was fresh tasting and well presented. Dinner at Ithaa was another stunner. We were not sure if the restaurant would be worthy of its high price tag... it is. Watching the sky slowly darken while being underwater with giant rays gliding by while dining on great food, was an experience our family will never forget. Dinner at Wine Cellar was another home run! Sommelier Michael was extremely informative and I loved his "mystery wine" pairing. Our Wine Cellar dinner group was a super fun bunch.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Paradise

reviews.text: A wonderful place! Dear simplicity or simple luxury. Excellent home reef. You will not be disappointed. Dive guides address some kind words . We dive all over the world, the organization of diving here is very high. Beautiful boats, great people. The villas are cozy, in these amazing aura. I been to many luxury hotels in the Maldives and the villas at Conrad I like the most. A spa water villa - its just a miracle.
reviews.title: Returned for the third time ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bars, restaurants, menu, quality of execution, the sorts of wines - all excellent. The cost of the underwater restaurant - yes, very high, but it is increasingly not an institution for meals, and a miracle of architecture, so the price is probably justified.
reviews.title: If not for the weather.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That sometimes spoils the impression - EVENING service in restaurant Vilu, dirty water around the hotel (there were discharges of waste).
reviews.title: The Promised Land…

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Similar in quality hotel - Four Sesons Landaa Giruvaru. In Kuda Hura villas are much weaker and the proximity of Male I do not like. Hard to compare. Something in the same hotel I like, something different. Worth visiting, and here and there.
reviews.title: The Ultimate for complete relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Originally we intended to resort-hop from one atoll to another, but with seaplane transfers in the picture that proved to be too expensive and difficult to arrange. Eventually we settled for Conrad Rangali (comprising two connected islets) with half the stay on an over-water villa and the other on a beach villa (on the other island) - substantially compromised but not a bad idea for longer stays.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with great amenities and friendly staff

aka: Conrad Maldives Rangali Island Hotel Rangali Island
description: Sleek, chic and just a little bit sexy, barefoot luxury meets unpretentious style at the six-star Conrad Maldives Rangali Island. Recently awarded “The Best Water Villas in the Maldives”, “The Best Suites in the World” and “Best Spa Resort in the Maldives”, this spectacular resort offers three different resort experiences on two islands: guests can enjoy the quintessential Maldivian hideaway on tiny Rangalifinolhu Island while also having access to the facilities of the larger and livelier Rangali Island which is linked to it by a 500m bridge. The third resort experience is at the Spa Retreat, an over-water destination spa that operates as a resort-within-a-resort.For relaxation, guests can find bliss in the resort’s three spas, dine in 11 restaurants and bars, enjoy an extensive range of excursions, diving and watersports options – including a submarine – snorkel the resort’s vibrant coral reef which is just steps from the beach or take part in unique activities such as manta watching at night, turtle conservation, dolphin-spotting excursions and snorkeling with whale sharks.
